meanings.definition: A person who evades payment or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The bilkers left without paying for their meal at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The shop owner caught the bilkers trying to leave without paying for the items.
meanings.sent3: The bilkers tried to sneak out of the movie theater without buying tickets.
meanings.sent4: The bilkers were like shadows, always disappearing before settling their debts.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bilkers running away without paying was etched in the waiter's memory.

meanings.sent1: Do not trust those who try to bilk you out of your hard-earned money.
meanings.sent2: The scammer attempted to bilk unsuspecting victims through a fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent3: The con artist's plan to bilk people out of their savings was foiled by the authorities.
meanings.sent4: He managed to bilk his way into the company, only to cause chaos and deceit.
meanings.sent5: The fraudster's attempt to bilk the elderly couple was met with swift justice.
